      • Field Detail

        • private static final java.lang.String BEAN_EHCACHE_REGION_FACTORY

        • private static final java.lang.String BEAN_EHCACHE_REGION_FACTORY4

          Use the existing ehCache CacheManager instance instead of creating a new instance. For use with Hibernate 3.x (use grails.plugin.cache.ehcache.hibernate.BeanEhcacheRegionFactory4 with Hibernate 4.0+). Configure in DataSource.groovy: hibernate.cache.region.factory_class = 'grails.plugin.cache.ehcache.hibernate.BeanEhcacheRegionFactory

          Authors:
          Craig Andrews
          Burt Beckwith

        • private final org.slf4j.Logger log

      • Property Detail

        • java.lang.String author

        • java.lang.Object issueManagement

        • java.lang.String license

        • java.lang.Object loadAfter

        • java.lang.Object organization

        • java.lang.Object pluginExcludes

        • java.lang.Object scm

        • java.lang.String title

        • java.lang.String version

          Use the existing ehCache CacheManager instance instead of creating a new instance. For use with Hibernate 4.0+. Configure in DataSource.groovy: hibernate.cache.region.factory_class = 'grails.plugin.cache.ehcache.hibernate.BeanEhcacheRegionFactory4 Note that most of this code is copied from org.hibernate.cache.DelegatingRegionFactory, which cannot be extended in this case as its constructor is package-scoped (and this class is not in the same package).

          Authors:
          Craig Andrews
